intro: Amphorocalyx latifolius, commonly known as the broadleaf amphora calyx, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the eastern coast of Africa, particularly Tanzania and Kenya. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
